intro: Alternanthera philoxerina, commonly known as red flame plant or red alternanthera, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaranthaceae family. It is native to South America and is characterized by its striking red foliage that becomes more vibrant under bright light. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or yellow, which appear in clusters at the base of the plant. This species is popular in aquatic and bog gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability to wet conditions.
